slides.title:
New Mexico Statute allows a customer 30 days from the date of purchase to complete the transfer of ownership of a vehicle or vessel.   

(Late Transfer Penalty (code 70) (ยง66-3-103(B))

AVOID FINES AND PENALTIES

Titling and registering a vehicle or vessel within the 30-day time frame will help the customer avoid late fines and penalties.

When the customer receives a Notice of Additional Requirements Letter, they have 10 days to return with the required document or information to avoid late registration penalties and late transfer fees.

What if a customer waits until the last minute?
If a customer comes in near the end of the 30-day period and has to return because of missing documents or information, he will probably be charged the late transfer fee.
But that decision is up to your supervisor.

Terri Rose
Terri is missing some of the documentation to title and register her vehicle.

A Notice of Additional Requirements Letter has been generated.

29 Days?
She waited 29 days after she purchased her vehicle to come in for the transfer.

To Avoid the Penalty
To avoid the penalty, Ms. Rose needs to return with her missing documentation by the end of the next business day.
At this point, your supervisor can make a decision about the late transfer fee.
Tapestry allows a Manager to override late penalty fees and transfer fees if he determines that the 10 days should be extended.
